entity.name: Mautic
entity.description: Mautic is the world's first open source marketing automation platform. Based on the Symfony framework and used by over 40,000 businesses worldwide to power their digital experience, Mautic became a fully independent open source project in April 2023 after spinning off from ownership by Acquia.

projects.name: Improve Mautic's bounce management
projects.description:
Please take a look at the full proposal on this link: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1FvzEtBmp-7kXjfIAnBo8ntFtWandzW3pdlfcmBVnR4M/edit.

The Problem

Mautic's processing of email webhooks from Omnivery, Mailgun and similar providers is a bit limited due to insufficient underlying model where we store information coming from webhooks. This proposal aims to add ability to the Mautic core in a way so that transport plugins can leverage them and map it more precisely to the Mautic core model.

We are looking for funding for implementation of the solution proposed in this document.

Proposed Solution

For the problem described above we are suggesting that we add a complaint flag into the DNC entity so transport plugins can use it when the provider (Omnivery, Mailgun, etc.) suggests so.

We would also like to introduce soft bounces into Mautic core in a way so that we still send to contacts that soft bounces, but if the soft bounce happens multiple times that translates to the DNC entity for that lead with a hard bounced flag.

How many times contact soft bounces consecutively before it translates to hard bounced is configurable with the setting in Configuration -> Email Settings.

We introduce soft bounce categories so that transport plugins can categorize and we can display that data to the end user.

We would add the following filters on segments: filter for DNC complaint reason, soft bounce filter and soft bounce of specific category.

We would like to show some more statistics about bounced, soft bounced and complaint contacts on the email list page.

We would like to show the count of soft bounces & complaints on the contact page. Also show how many soft bounces until the hard bounce for the given contact and to show the count of soft bounces & complaints on email list view.

projects.name: Project Lead Support
projects.description:
Mautic's governance model includes a Project Lead who is employed by the Mautic Council to work full time for the benefit of the Mautic project. Currently this role is held by Ruth Cheesley since 2020.

Presently this is the only resource available on a full-time basis to support the Mautic project, and Ruth does a great job of pulling everything together and keeping the project moving forward.

projects.name: Making Mautic the most privacy-friendly marketing tool
projects.description:
As of today, Mautic can't be used fully compliant with GDPR for all functions. There are possible hacks and patches, but out of the box several functions are not compliant. Also other regulations in other regions might be concerned (e.g California Consumer Privacy Act CCPA).

We have done some initial scoping on what's required: https://twzn.de/mauticdp.

projects.name: Full time community-focused developer
projects.description:
Mautic has no developers who work solely for the open source project as a core maintainer. We're entirely reliant on businesses providing good will and allowing their staff time to contribute during their working day, or volunteers working extra hours in their spare time.

We would like to mitigate this risk, by having the opportunity to hire a full-time developer who will work as part of the core team on projects and initiatives, as well as general triage and keeping up with bug reports, PRs from contributors, and generally improving the developer experience. This is featured in our 2025 budget which has been adopted by the General Assembly in 2024.
